meanings.sent1: The sinew in his ankle helped him jump high.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the sinew in her wrist for any injuries.
meanings.sent3: The sinew in the rubber band was stretched to its limit.
meanings.sent4: The sinew of the ship's mast held strong against the storm.
meanings.sent5: The sinew of the spider's web glistened in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To strengthen or give power to.
meanings.sent1: Exercise can sinew your muscles and make you stronger.
meanings.sent2: The coach aimed to sinew the team's resolve before the big game.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient was said to sinew the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent4: Her determination sinewed her spirit to overcome any obstacle.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes sinewed the painting with emotion.
